data.text: @MarkChangizi Looking at the numbers from Ian Miller you'd think so

@MarkChangizi Yes, before Covid you weren’t supposed to wear the same mask for multiple patients.  Masks are only effective for short bits of time because they are useless if they’ve been contaminated.

@MarkChangizi Been saying this from the beginning. 1) Air trapped in void between mask and face is inhaled. 2) Any virions "stuck" in mask material, experience stronger inward air flow than outward (due to leakage), causing them to be "knocked off" from mask & inhaled.

@MarkChangizi @ZachariasFoegen @districtai @Hold2LLC "... the Foegen effect: Deep re-breathing of condensed droplets or pure virions trapped in the form of droplets in the mask can worsen the prognosis"

https://t.co/jqdm6YPye3
@MarkChangizi This was the “consensus” back in the pre Covid era
@MarkChangizi Thanks, Mark. I am so grateful again to you. This is a very interesting study and needs wider distribution. It would certainly explain a lot.
@MarkChangizi "...deep re-inhalation of hypercondensed droplets or pure virions caught in facemasks as droplets can worsen prognosis and might be linked to long-term effects of COVID-19 infection."
